title.value: Adult Mental Health Service Discharge Summary

tr.td: Accident and emergency or dental casualty department of the Health Care Provider
NHS other Hospital Provider - Ward for general Patients or the younger physically disabled or A and E department

td.p: Brought to the hospital A+E department by the police as had been involved in a disturbance in a shopping centre, assaulting another customer.
Agitated on interview and denying any thoughts of self-harm.
Well known to local mental health services.

tr.th: Treatments and interventions and changes made to treatments

td.p: Tested negative for banned substances following admission.
Diagnosis of Paranoid Schizophrenia, frequently uncompliant with treatment.
Due to poor adherence with treatment she was discharged from hospital subject to a Community Treatment Order and is, therefore, subject to recall to hospital if she does not adhere to treatment.

tr.td: Patient discharged on clinical advice or with clinical consent
Temporary place of residence when usually resident elsewhere (e.g. hotels, residential Educational Establishment)
No special requirements, but states that her daughter should be contacted in an emergency.
Patient warned that she is subject to recall to hospital if she does not adhere to treatment.

td.pre:
Full Blood Count

tr.td: Patient has consented to treatment, but will be subject to recall to hospital if she does not adhere to treatment.
Diazepam 2mg tablets (A A H Pharmaceuticals Ltd)
Take three 2mg tablets daily for 7 days

title.value: Patient and carer concerns, expectations and wishes

display.value: Patient and carer concerns, expectations and wishes

tr.th: Patient and carer concerns, expectations and wishes
tr.td: Patient stated "I want to stay with my daughter till I recover."

Name: Susan Smith
Relationship: Next of kin
Contact details: Tel: 0782345678 Email: mrssuesmith@mymail.com

td.p: Address Line: Twenty One Fifty, Thorpe Park,
Physical attention will be needed from Primary Care due to the fact she is an atypical antipsychotic and will need weight and general health monitoring
Person responsible: Dr Gillingham, Leeds Recovery and Support Team.
Outcome and expectations: The patient is expected to benefit from physical attention from healthcare professionals and understands that she must attend her appointments.

tr.th: Actions for patient or their carer
tr.td: Patient has agreed to commence the prescribed medication and expects this to improve her condition.

tr.th: Agreed with patient or legitimate patient representative
tr.td: Patient has agreed to treatment plan and expects this to improve her mental and physical condition.
CPA Status and 117 Aftercare: Follow up will be made by the Leeds Recovery and Support team. 7 Day Follow up will be done by the community team.

td.p: Name: Leeds Mental Health NHS Trust
Address Line: Twenty One Fifty, Thorpe Park

tr.td: Can be abusive and agitated when non compliant with treatment
Frequently uncompliant with treatment and during these times often misuses alcohol and cannabis.
